alert.note: Alert for Okanogan Highlands; Okanogan Valley; Western Okanogan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 2:40PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm outflow will impact portions of Okanogan County through 330 PM PDT... At 234 PM PDT, automated weather stations and public reports on social media reported wind gusts of 40 mph or more over portions of Okanogan county. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs, blow around unsecured objects, reduce visibility due to blowing dust, and cause fires to spread quickly. Locations impacted include... Omak, Okanogan, Oroville, Tonasket, Twisp, Winthrop, Riverside, Conconully, and numerous campgrounds in northern and western Okanogan county. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Omak Lake, Pearrygin Lake, or Lake Osoyoos, be prepared for rough water and the threat of lightning. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

area.areaDesc: Okanogan Highlands; Okanogan Valley; Western Okanogan County
